CreatingNewProject.Overview: Steps to create and configure a new project in Unreal Engine.

Steps.Description: Select the development category that matches your project goals.
Select a template for your project based on the chosen category.
Configure Project Defaults, including platform, quality, and ray tracing settings.

Settings.Name: Starter Content
Settings.Description: Include basic assets for quick experimentation.

Steps.Description: Select storage location and name the project.

CreatingNewProject.Result: Unreal Engine creates and opens the new project with the configured settings.

OpeningExistingProject.Overview: Methods to access and open existing Unreal Engine projects.

Steps: Click Unreal Engine on the left navigation.
Launch Unreal Engine, Project Browser opens.
Double-click project thumbnail or select and click Open.

Options: Always load last project on startup

Steps: Select project from list and click Open or double-click thumbnail.

Details.Browse: Click Browse to locate .uproject file if not in list.

Steps: Ensure correct Unreal Engine version is installed.
Navigate to project's folder on disk.
Methods.Warning: Opening with a different UE version can cause data corruption; open a copy to preserve original.
